items.summary: Redesign the StandardZombie 3D mesh in EnemyMesh.tsx to resemble a Call of Duty-style zombie: add a more humanoid body with visible torso, arms, and legs as separate geometric segments; give the head a skull-like shape with sunken eye sockets (dark hollow eye geometry); add torn/ragged clothing geometry (overlapping flat planes or box segments with dark/blood-stained colors); use a desaturated, pale greenish-grey skin tone for body parts; add protruding jaw/lower-face detail; keep toon-shading but shift colors to necrotic (pale green-grey skin, dark red blood accents, torn dark-brown clothing).

Redesign the BossZombie 3D mesh in EnemyMesh.tsx to look like a heavily mutated CoD boss zombie: larger bulkier torso with uneven shoulder masses, oversized arms, a deformed enlarged skull, exposed bone/rib geometry on the chest, glowing red/orange sunken eyes (emissive small sphere geometry), and heavily torn dark clothing. Use a darker necrotic skin tone than the standard zombie to visually distinguish it as an elite threat.

Add a subtle idle sway/lurch animation to both zombie types in EnemyMesh.tsx: the torso should lean forward slightly and arms should hang low with a side-to-side shoulder sway, mimicking the iconic CoD zombie lurch movement. This should complement the existing walking bob animation.
